result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Gregory J Panawash was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 66 days were granted.
03/30/2016 COURT GRANTS ADDITIONAL 195 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT FOR TOTAL OF 261 DAYS.
10/29/2021 DEFENDANT COMPLETED THE SAP PROGRAM AS OF 08/21/18. PER DOC, TOTAL TIME IN CUSTODY WAS 35 MONTHS. CONVICTION STATUS SENT TO DMV SHOWING CHANGE FROM 5 YRS TO 35 MONTHS. THIS INCLUDES SENTENCE CREDIT.
Concurrent with: Present Sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Sheriff's Dept. Costs to be paid as a conditio of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
ATTEND the Victim Impact Panel Meeting while on Extended Supervision.

No operation of any vehicle without a valid Driver's License. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment or aftercare and/or counseling recommended by agent. Inform agent of all prescriptions.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gregory J Panawash in court by Video Conference with attorney Jamie J LaVora.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing. Defendant waives right to be in court in person for sentencing hearing. State gives sentencing recommendations. Defendant's sister makes statements on behalf of the Defendant. Atty LaVora makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT#1:

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

10 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 66 days)  ***CONCURRENT TO PRESENT SENTENCE***
  -  5 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  5 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

*D/L REVOCATION: 36 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment or aftercare and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done (no surcharges).
*No operation of any vehicle without a valid Driver's License
*Victim Impact Panel to be completed when released on extended supervision

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $ 35.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - to be forwarded to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department);

FINE:  $8,373.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA surcharge: $250.00

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is / is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
  Check Case scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 07:45 am.

Defendant to appear by videoconference from Fox Lake Correctional for sentencing hearing.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
